results.title: Unfaithfully yours (1984)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Daniel Melnick, Joe Wizan, Marvin Worth and Howard Zieff
results.brief_description: This remake of the 1948 Preston Sturges classic stars Dudley Moore as the symphony conductor who imagines ways to get back at the wife he believes is unfaithful to him. As his jeaslousy escalates, the disastrous after-shocks provide an arrary of farcical situations as Claude lays traps, fantasizes about double murder and sets about stalking his prey. Also stars Armand Assante and Natassja Kinski.

results.title: Undead
results.creator_credit: Spierigfilm, Imagine Entertainment (US), Michael Spierig and Peter Spierig
results.brief_description: Australian twin filmmaking brothers, Michael and Peter Spierig, have written, produced and directed this, their first feature film. They have achieved their goal of creating a schlock splatter horror with a load of laughs but with a sci-fi alien plot twist that makes it stands out. What also stands out is the finish of the film as its low budget is not that evident in the final outcome. Fictional small Australian country town of Berkeley, renowned for its good fishing, is invaded by aliens that send strange meteors from space turning people into the undead - zombies. The local beauty contest winner Rene (Felicity Mason) is about to leave town but is prevented when her driver becomes victim to zombie attack. The local town loony, a tall silent bloke called Marion (Mungo McKay), comes to her aid with a three-barrelled custom-made rifle. Blood, gore, splatter and laughs aplenty ensue as our hapless heroes (including the swearing town cop and his rookie constable, Wayne and his pregnant girlfriend) go about surviving the onslaught of brain sucking zombies. The aliens appear on earth cleansing some folks with healing rain and they are then ascended to orbit the earth. The ending has the potential for a sequel and hopefully someone will give them the money! This is must see cult classic for those into the schlock/horror or low budget independent genre/s. Crew that deserve special mention are the make-up designer Steven Boyle, cinematographer Andrew Strahorn, composer Cliff Bradley and everyone that worked on the special effects, which includes the directors. (“The Making Of” in the extras is worth a look if you’re thinking of making a low budget feature!) Hopefully there will be more from The Spierig Brothers in the future. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Umberto D
results.creator_credit: DEAR Film, Nino Misiano and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Italian directors of the post-WWII generation, responding to the calamity of facism, to the widespread poverty in both the cities and countryside, and by necessity needing to film inexpensively and to be unencumbered by studio costs, developed a radical realist cinematic aesthetics: neo-realism. Vittorio De Sica became justly famous for his groundbreaking “The Bicycle Thieves”, utilising street locations and performances by non-actors, but it is his unsentimental “Umberto D” that now stands up as the most important film of the Italian neo-realist period. Umberto is a retired civil servant who finds himself unwanted and ignored now that his working days are over. Only his dog gives him affection; humans treat him as already dead, an old man to be shoved aside if they even see him at all. Almost documentary-like in its observation of Umberto (played with sustained brilliance by Carlo Battisti), the film quickly envelops us in the old man’s daily struggles and we find ourselves completely mesmerised by his story, we find ourselves identifying with this tale of a most ordinary “unremarkable” man. As Umberto faces his aching loneliness, and death seemingly becomes his only salvation, we as viewers have to confront our own immersion in the sterility and brutality of our industrialised urban world. The great critic Pauline Kael argued that “Umberto D” is one of those rare films that changes the viewer, that on once seeing the film you can never view the world in the same way again. Critic George Kaufman called it one of “the greatest halfdozen films ever made”. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Ulee's gold
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Clinica Estetico and Victor Nunez
results.brief_description: This touching film presents a subtle study of the difficulties and complexities involved in the development and maintenance of lasting human relations. It reveals how abnormal events force one self-exiled loner to reassess his moral and emotional beliefs and to redeem his sense of personal and familial strength. Ulee, a Vietnam veteran turned beekeeper, in the tradition of generations before him, watches his family disintegrate when his son, Jimmy, lands in jail for robbery and his daughter-in-law disappears, leaving their two daughters in Ulee’s care. Ulee takes refuge from this state of affairs in the production of his high-grade honey with the unspoken assistance of his youngest granddaughter. However, when Jimmy’s partners begin threatening his family, thinking that Jimmy has hidden the proceeds of their robbery, Ulee’s stubbornly suppressed sense of the unconditional bond and care that links his family begins to surface and he becomes involved in the tenuous situation. Nunez handles this film with a simplicity and sensitivity that effectively evokes the personal journey of Ulee and the rest of his family in challenging circumstances.

results.title: Ugly, dirty and bad = Brutti, sporchi e cattivi
results.creator_credit: Compagnia Cinematografica Champion, Carlo Ponti and Ettore Scola
results.brief_description: Director Ettore Scola focuses on a large dysfunctional family living in a shanty town on the outskirts of Rome. The stingy patriarch, Giacinto, is personally wealthy but morally bankrupt, and his repulsive view of life trickles down to every member of his clan. Not content with corrupting his own flesh and blood, Giacinto spreads his philosophy throughout the entire village, where he functions as slumlord. Although the surroundings and characters exist at the lowest level of society, their misery is very funny at times, imbued with enormous energy in a daily fight to maintain their survival. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes Nino Manfredi, Maria Bosco and Giselda Castrini.

results.title: Ugetsu Monogatari = Tales of the pale and silvery moon after the rain
results.creator_credit: Daiei Motion Picture Company, Masaichi Nagata and Kenji Mizoguchi
results.brief_description: An unforgettably haunting film in every sense, this film is adapted from two stories in a collection of ghostly tales by the eighteenth-century writer Akinari Ueda, and Guy De Maupassant. Genjuro, a poor potter trying to make a living in a war-torn medieval village, is lured away from his devoted wife and young son by the mysterious Lady Wasaka who turns out to be a ghost. When Genjuro returns home repentant, his wife, too, has become a ghost after being murdered by stragglers weary from battle. Mizoguchi’s depiction of the past is vivid, richly detailed but not in the least romantic. For all its panache, the age he shows us is one of cruelty, oppression, and often appalling casual brutality. Cast includes Masayuki Mori, Kinuyo Tanaka and Machiko Kyo. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Two women = La Ciociara (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Marceau, Cocinor, Societe Generale de Cinematographie, Carlo Ponti and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Two women is the story of Cesira and Rosetta, mother and daughter, living in Rome and running a grocery store under grim World War II conditions. After a raid, Cesira, a beautiful widow who is propositioned at every turn, decides to relocate them to the rural village where she was born. Cesira idealises her innocent teenage daughter, attempting to shield her from the reality of war crimes and the potential danger (in particular rape) that the two face. Michele (Jean-Paul Belmondo) an idealist, who is horrified by the pettiness of the villagers, falls in love with Cesira. A love triangle forms between mother, daughter and Michele as war closes in around the village. Adapted from the Italian novel by Alberto Moravia, “Two women” effectively displays the randomness of war that can turn an individual’s fate to terror and the deprivations that reduce simple acts of kindness to bitter transactions. Sophia Loren won an Academy Award for her portrayal of Cesira, an uncommon accolade at that time. This is the dubbed version with Sophia Loren dubbing her own voice. Directed by Vittoria De Sica (The Bicycle Thief, Umberto D., Marriage - Italian style).

results.title: Two women = La Ciociara
results.creator_credit: Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Marceau, Cocinor, Societe Generale de Cinematographie, Carlo Ponti and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: The story centers on a widow (Sophia Loren) who runs a tiny grocery store in Rome. When the store is bombed, she decides to return to her native village with her 13 year old daughter (Eleonora Brown). Back in her village, a timid schoolteacher (Jean-Paul Belmondo) falls in love with her. Her young daughter also secretly falls in love with him and becomes alienated from her mother because of it. While he is on a war mision, he is killed and the mother and daughter become friends once more and agree to carry on. They seek refuge in a church as they make they way back to Rome and encounter an event that will change their lives forever. Version dubbed in English. Adapted from a novel by Alberto Moravia.

results.title: Two mules for Sister Sara
results.creator_credit: Carroll Case, Don Siegel, Universal Pictures and Martin Rackin
results.brief_description: Two Mules for Sister Sara is a freewheeling, anarchic adventure set in a French-occupied Mexico in the 19th century. An American mercenary (Clint Eastwood) rescues a nun (Shirley Maclaine) from her would-be-molesters, only to later discover that the chance meeting has been a stroke of luck for him, as she knows a great deal about the officers in the garrison he plans to invade. As they embark on a journey together, there develops a sexual tension between the two which comes to an explosive end together with the garrison under attack. Includes a musical score by Ennio Morricone.

As they embark on a journey together, there develops a sexual tension between the two which comes to an explosive end together with the garrison under attack. Includes a musical score by Ennio Morricone.

results.title: Two hands
results.creator_credit: CML, Meridian Films, Marian MacGowan and Gregor Jordan
results.brief_description: Set in Sydney’s King’s Cross, 19 year old Jimmy (Heath Ledger) finds himself in debt to a local gangster, Pando, played by perennial Australian actor Bryan Brown, when a simple job goes wrong. Jimmy’s life depends on his locating the $10,000 he has lost. As his scheme to replace the cash is played out, two street kids are enjoying a shopping spree with the original loot. The black humour of the film progressively darkens as the story unfolds. Rose Byrne co-stars as country girl, Alex, who becomes involved with Jimmy and his increasingly dire situation.
